channel.title: 4x/0.25 – Solar Anamnesis
channel.description: Scenes from the Solar System's Youth

item.title: Clarendon (c) Meteorite Thin Section
item.dc:creator: solaranamnesis
item.description: The Clarendon (c) meteorite is a wonderful example of a named L4 chondrite with fusion crust. In the gigapixel image below one may see many diverse and distinct chondritic inclusions. Full Screen Meteorite Thin Section Panoramas: View on Gigapan | View with krpano Click to Load Purchase Prints Visit Store

item.title: NWA 6472 Meteorite Surface
item.dc:creator: solaranamnesis
item.description: With a classification of LL3.2, the NWA 6472 meteorite provides an abundance of fascinating chondrules. The colors are really amazing in cross polarized reflected light as seen in this surface focus stacked panorama taken with the Nikon Z6 attached to the LM scope adapter. Full Screen Meteorite Thin Section Panoramas: View on Gigapan | View […]

item.title: NWA 2224 Meteorite Surface
item.dc:creator: solaranamnesis
item.description: Surface panorama of the NWA 2224 meteorite. The images were captured in cross polarized reflected light with a Nikon Z6. Full Screen Meteorite Thin Section Panoramas: View on Gigapan | View with krpano Click to Load Purchase Prints Visit Store

item.title: NWA 2224 Meteorite Thin Section
item.dc:creator: solaranamnesis
item.description: Presented here is the second in a series of three large panoramas of the NWA 2224 meteorite. The images were captured with light between polarization filters set to low degree for effect. Full Screen Meteorite Thin Section Panoramas: View on Gigapan | View with krpano Click to Load Purchase Prints Visit Store

item.title: NWA 2224 Meteorite Thin Section
item.dc:creator: solaranamnesis
item.description: Presented here is a large panorama of the NWA 2224 meteorite. There are a number of interesting inclusions and chondrules. Although the left side is thinner in spots, resulting in a different polarization, it helps reveal other details.
